justification: The Materials section states that participants completed “a selection of 14 items … from the 37-item Basic Literacy In Statistics (BLIS) scale,” which was used to assess their level of statistical literacy.

measured_by: Six-item Propensity to Trust scale (VAS version)
justification: Participants answered “a VAS rating scale version of the six-item ‘propensity to trust scale items’,” indicating that the trait ‘propensity to trust’ was measured with this six-item scale.

measured_by: Visual analogue rating scale (0–5) for ADA familiarity
justification: The demographic questionnaire included “a visual analogue rating scale (VAS) ranging from 0 [not very familiar] to 5 [very familiar]” to gauge “their level of familiarity with ADA.”
construct: Familiarity with algorithms, data, and AI (ADA familiarity)

measured_by: VAS rating scale (0–5) responses to two scenario questions about likelihood to trust/recommend/use algorithms
justification: After each of the 12 scenarios, participants answered two questions such as “How likely are you to regularly trust this app…?” on “a VAS rating scale from 0 (not at all likely) to 5 (very likely),” operationalising trust in algorithms.
